column4: i'm trying to do a distribution update, but the urls it is trying to download the files from don't exist...
what/where should i change this to
apt-get update dies on the same thing
apparently this is because fiesty now longer is update
why do repositories for older versions of ubuntu just get deleted with no way to update anymore?
its kind of expensive maintaining repositories, and ubuntu's philosophy is new release every six months, there are long term support releases that are supported for 3 years, hardy is lts
i should at least be given the option to update to a newer version though....
how? it won't let me because these repos were removed
what do u want to upgrade to?
oh you are trying to upgrade from old version to slightly newer but still old :)
i'm trying to upgrade to whatever i can upgrade to
